prefixDef.p: Private URIs using the teiCorpusHeader prefix are pointers to any element in the WIBARAB teiCorpus document.
Private URIs using the share prefix are pointers to audio file residing on the WIBARAB network share.
Private URIs using the geo prefix are pointers to the xml:id attribute on a place element in VICAV Geodata list.
Private URIs using the dmp prefix are pointers to the xml:id attribute on an element in the WIBARAB DMP document..
Private URIs using the zotid prefix are pointers to the xml:id attribute on a biblStruct element in the TEI export of the VICAV Zotero Group library.
Private URIs using the sources prefix are pointers to the xml:id attribute on an element in the WIBARAB list of sources.

listPerson.head: All Speakers in the WIBARAB Corpus

ptr.target: corpus:the marriage audio. I have split this into _marriage_1 and marriage_2
corpus:No metadata but we have consent
corpus:no information or consent on this guy
corpus:very interested in culture and the arts
corpus:seems to be a daughter of SAU_2022_Speaker14
corpus:no information or consent from her
corpus:wife of SAU_2022_Speaker 9 and mother of _DaughterSheikh1/2
corpus:Sister of SAU_2022_Speaker14; estimated birth year. Very modern woman
corpus:but aware of traditions. Knows very well how to roast coffee and showed me how to do it while also explaining some traditional dishes. I have photos and a video
corpus:she wears a modern interpretation of the Niqab for the photos.

corpus:Two old ladies were invited to the house to show us traditional weaving. They are paid by the government to give workshops on this and also sell what they make. They expect to be paid for showing their craft and are proud of being licensed by the government.

corpus:Two old ladies were invited to the house to show us traditional weaving. They are paid by the government to give workshops on this and also sell what they make. They expect to be paid for showing their craft and are proud of being licensed by the government.
corpus:poet and owner of multiple stables
corpus:no information or consent on this guy
corpus:no information or consent on this guy
corpus:married to a German woman. Speaks German very well and has lived in Germany. He has travelled far and is a former member of parliament. His son Omar has also been very helpful.
corpus:seems to be educated and maybe in his 40s-50s
corpus:another man asking questions to Speaker10
corpus:Owner of a small shop in Karantina
corpus:From Marouahine but met him in Sour
corpus:lived most of his life in the desert.
corpus:very high education; teacher of computing engineering; she has 3 children and was pregnant
corpus:she is from the mutayr in the rashayda and her mother is an indian
corpus:has at least 2 sons who were in the interview
corpus:Son of Speaker 2 and brother of Speaker 4
corpus:brother of Speaker 3 and husband of Speaker 1
corpus:high education; in the questionnaire with the majlis men (ajloun_2)
corpus:the one who speaks the most
corpus:has a bachelors in the arabic language
corpus:and involved in some community organisation in kufranjah
corpus:seemingly high education; father of the two children
corpus:has a wife from Bani Ṣaxar

corpus:he was a school principal and now a part of some organisation for university students in Kufranja; he spoke mostly in ajloun_1. He says that the rashayda in kunfranjah for the most part came from Shobak
corpus:runs the fan page of the rashayda in jordan
corpus:from ʕAǧlūn but is often in ʕAmmān
corpus:engineer with a masters accompanying speaker19
corpus:from ʕAǧlūn but often in ʕAmmān
corpus:parents are born in palestine but she is born in Amman
corpus:but she is the youngest. She is doing a masters and works as a lawyer
corpus:wife of speaker13 and mother of speaker16 (and speaker15?). Moved to Karama after the 67 war
corpus:second bani saxar companion with only this family
corpus:mother from refugee camp al-baqaʕa; identifies as palestinian but born in jordan in the refugee camp where she still lives
corpus:the one who speaks the most
corpus:got me in touch with the refugee camp family
corpus:runs a culture house in Ajloun
corpus:from Karak but was raised and lives in Amman
corpus:Part of the Hwetat from the Squr branch
corpus:runs a camp for tourists in Wadi Finan

prefixDef.p: Private URIs using the teiCorpusHeader prefix are pointers to any element in the WIBARAB teiCorpus document.
Private URIs using the share prefix are pointers to audio file residing on the WIBARAB network share.
Private URIs using the geo prefix are pointers to the xml:id attribute on a place element in VICAV Geodata list.
Private URIs using the dmp prefix are pointers to the xml:id attribute on an element in the WIBARAB DMP document..
Private URIs using the zotid prefix are pointers to the xml:id attribute on a biblStruct element in the TEI export of the VICAV Zotero Group library.
Private URIs using the sources prefix are pointers to the xml:id attribute on an element in the WIBARAB list of sources.

prefixDef.p: Private URIs using the teiCorpusHeader prefix are pointers to any element in the WIBARAB teiCorpus document.
Private URIs using the share prefix are pointers to audio file residing on the WIBARAB network share.
Private URIs using the geo prefix are pointers to the xml:id attribute on a place element in VICAV Geodata list.
Private URIs using the dmp prefix are pointers to the xml:id attribute on an element in the WIBARAB DMP document..
Private URIs using the zotid prefix are pointers to the xml:id attribute on a biblStruct element in the TEI export of the VICAV Zotero Group library.
Private URIs using the sources prefix are pointers to the xml:id attribute on an element in the WIBARAB list of sources.

prefixDef.p: Private URIs using the teiCorpusHeader prefix are pointers to any element in the WIBARAB teiCorpus document.

Private URIs using the geo prefix are pointers to the xml:id attribute on a place element in VICAV Geodata list.
Private URIs using the dmp prefix are pointers to the xml:id attribute on an element in the WIBARAB DMP document..
Private URIs using the zotid prefix are pointers to the xml:id attribute on a biblStruct element in the TEI export of the VICAV Zotero Group library.
Private URIs using the sources prefix are pointers to the xml:id attribute on an element in the WIBARAB list of sources.
